mods.note: No. Passage in question should read '‘he fled from Persian Azerbaijan to Bagdad.' FROM FOREIGN OFFICE TO KUIBYSHEV. No.1211, August 17th L942, D. 11,30 p.Q. august 17th 1542. yS/N/N/S/S/N /NX* Your telegram No.1165 [of 14th August: activities of Sultan Beg Husseinzadeh]. Paragraph 2 as received here states that person named fled to Afghanistan in 1941. Should this read India? O.T.P,Pi.[CYPHER] DEPARTMENTAL NO, 2, FROM KUIBY SHE V TO FOREIGN OFFICE . Sir A Clark Kerr. No* 1165 14th August, 1942* £ D. 5.22.p.m. 15th August, 1942. R. 4.50.p.m. 15th August, 1942. £ £ £ Peopled Commissariat for Foreign Affairs have handed me aide m&moire about a certain Sultan Beg Husseinzadeh. 2. This man is stated to have excaped in 1925 from Baku to Persia where for many years he indulged in anti- Soviet activities. After entry of Societ Forces into Persia in 1941 he fled from Persian Azerbaijan to Afghanistan where he continued his subversive activities and kept in touch with (jerman agents. 3. The aide mfemoire states that the Soviet Government considers it essential that steps should be taken as soon as possible to hand him oyer to the Soviet authorities and asks that the British Military Authorities may be instructed to this effect. 4. FROM KUIBYSHEV TO FOREIGN OFFICE . Sir A Clark Kerr. No. 1165 “ 14th August, 1942. D. 5.22.p.m. 15th August, 1942. R. 4.50.p.m. 15th August, 1942. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Foreign Office and the British Embassy at Kuibyshev [Samara, Russia], regarding Sultan Beg Husseinzadeh, a political subversive active between Persian Azerbaijan and Afghanistan, who is to be handed over to Soviet authorities.
